Home.ConferenceShort: The largest tech conference in the Central Valley!
Home.DevfestPara1: are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Googleâ€™s technologies. Each DevFest is carefully crafted for you by your local GDG community to bring in awesome speakers, great topics, and lots fun! While no two events will be exactly alike, each GDG DevFest will, at its core, be powered by a shared belief that when developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen!
Home.DevfestPara2: is a 100% community organized full-day developer conference featuring awesome world-class speakers from technology leaders within the community as well as Google product team developers.
Home.IWDPara1: (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions around the globe, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation for women to a celebration of women's economic, political, and social achievements. Each IWD will be tailored to local communities of women in technology. Summits and meetups around the world may feature hands-on coding workshops, inspiring speakers, and networking opportunities.
Home.IWDPara2: is a 100% community organized event that aims to provide visibility, community, and resources for women in technology. Our event is designed to promote an environment of inclusivity for women in tech, as well as celebrate women innovators and leaders in the industry.
Home.COCHeader: Be nice. Be respectful. Be collaborative.
Home.COCPara1: is dedicated to a harassment-free conference experience for everyone.
Home.COCPara3: This Code of Conduct applies to all attendees, speakers, volunteers, vendors, and organizers at

Footer.AboutUs: We are a technology user group that meets regularly to discuss the latest Google Technologies, Tools, SDKs, APIs, and much more.
Footer.DisclaimerStatement: is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation.

COC.COCPar1: is dedicated to providing a fun harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, socioeconomic status, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any conference venue, including talks. Conference participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the conference without a refund at the discretion of the conference organizers.
COC.COCPar2: Conference staff will be happy to help participants contact venue security or local law enforcement, provide escorts, or otherwise assist those experiencing harassment to feel safe for the duration of the conference. We value your attendance.
COC.Call911: If your physical safety or the physical safety of others is at risk, please dial 911 immediately.
COC.RAINN: Sexual Assault Crisis Line/Victims Crisis Line (24 hours)
COC.FCOCPar11: To make clear what is expected, all attendees, speakers, exhibitors, organizers and volunteers at
COC.FCOCPar12: are required to conform to the following Code of Conduct. Organizers will enforce this code throughout the event.
COC.FCOCPar2: is dedicated to providing a fun harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, socioeconomic status, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any conference venue, including talks. Conference participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the conference without a refund at the discretion of the conference organizers.
COC.Harassment: Harassment includes, but is not limited to
COC.FCOCOpt1: Verbal comments that reinforce social structures of domination related to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, socioeconomic status, or religion (or lack thereof)
COC.FCOCOpt5: Sustained disruption of talks or other events
COC.FCOCOpt8: Advocating for, or encouraging, any of the above behavior
COC.EnfPar1: Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.
COC.EnfPar2: Exhibitors in the expo hall, sponsor or vendor booths, or similar activities are also subject to the anti-harassment policy. In particular, exhibitors should not use sexualized images, activities, or other material. Booth staff (including volunteers) should not use sexualized clothing/uniforms/costumes, or otherwise create a sexualized environment.
COC.EnfPar3: If a participant engages in harassing behaviour, event organizers retain the right to take any actions to keep the event a welcoming environment for all participants. This includes warning the offender or expulsion from the conference with no refund.
COC.EnfPar4: Event organizers may take action to redress anything designed to, or with the clear impact of, disrupting the event or making the environment hostile for any participants.
COC.EnfPar5: We expect participants to follow these rules at all event venues and event-related social activities. We think people should follow these rules outside event activities too!
COC.ReportPar1: If someone makes you or anyone else feel unsafe or unwelcome, please report it as soon as possible. Harassment and other code of conduct violations reduce the value of our event for everyone. We want you to be happy at our event. People like you make our event a better place.
COC.ReportPar2: You can make a report either personally or anonymously.
COC.ReportPar3: You can make an anonymous report here
COC.ReportPar4: We can't follow up an anonymous report with you directly, but we will fully investigate it and take whatever action is necessary to prevent a recurrence.
COC.ReportPar51: You can make a personal report by contacting a
COC.ReportPar6: When taking a personal report, our staff will ensure you are safe and cannot be overheard. They may involve other event staff to ensure your report is managed properly. Once safe, we'll ask you to tell us about what happened. This can be upsetting, but we'll handle it as respectfully as possible, and you can bring someone to support you. You won't be asked to confront anyone and we won't tell anyone who you are.
COC.ReportPar7: Our team will be happy to help you contact venue security, local law enforcement, local support services, provide escorts, or otherwise assist you to feel safe for the duration of the event. We value your attendance.
COC.LicPar11: This Code of Conduct was forked from the example policy from the
COC.LicPar2: created by the Ada Initiative and other volunteers. which is under a Creative Commons Zero license.
